revised_title: Investigation of Long-Chain Sulphonic Acids Diffusion
tldr: The article presents an investigation of the diffusion of long-chain sulphonic acids, revealing a sharp minimum in moderately dilute solutions followed by an abrupt rise to double the value in slightly higher concentrations. The findings support the presence of both neutral micelles and ionic micelles, as previously proposed by McBain and collaborators to explain the relationship between conductivity and thermodynamic data for colloidal electrolytes.
